alert.note: Alert for Far Northeast Highlands; Guadalupe County; Northeast Highlands; Santa Fe Metro Area; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; Upper Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued April 04 at 2:10PM MDT until April 05 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. * WHERE...Guadalupe County, Santa Fe Metro Area, Tusas Mountains Including Chama, Upper Rio Grande Valley, Far Northeast Highlands and Northeast Highlands. * WHEN...From 11 AM to 8 PM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of blowing dust will reduce visibility on area roadways. This includes Interstates 25 and 40 as well as U.S. Highways 64 and 285.
info.instruction: Take action to secure trash cans, lawn furniture, and other loose or lightweight outdoor objects. Extremely hazardous driving conditions can be expected, especially for motorists in high profile vehicles who should consider delaying travel.

area.areaDesc: Far Northeast Highlands; Guadalupe County; Northeast Highlands; Santa Fe Metro Area; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; Upper Rio Grande Valley
